remarks: The path homotopy equivalence relation on two paths ` F , G ` with the same start and end point can be written in terms of the loop ` F - G ` formed by concatenating ` F ` with the inverse of ` G ` .  Thus, all the homotopy information in ` ~=ph `` J ` is available if we restrict our attention to closed loops, as in the definition of the fundamental group.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Feb-2015.)
statement:

pcophtb.p $e |- P = ( ( 0 [,] 1 ) X. { ( F ` 0 ) } ) $.
pcophtb.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( II Cn J ) ) $.
pcophtb.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( II Cn J ) ) $.
pcophtb.0 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` 0 ) = ( G ` 0 ) ) $.
pcophtb.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` 1 ) = ( G ` 1 ) ) $.
pcophtb $p |- ( ph -> ( ( F ( *p ` J ) H ) ( ~=ph ` J ) P <-> F ( ~=ph ` J ) G ) ) $.
$d G x $.
$d J x $.
